Wow they made orange jelly hmm pretty impressive,Â

Centrifugal force is an apparent force thatÂ 
appears to pull something away from the centerÂ Â

when it goes on a curved path. Really it'sÂ 
actually just the inertia keeping the objectÂ Â

on the path that was going rather than pullingÂ 
away from the center but we call that apparentÂ Â

force centrifugal force. We can demonstrateÂ 
that by getting James to spin a bucket of waterÂ Â

over his head ... and as you can seeÂ 
he doesn't get wet because the force isÂ Â

keeping the water on the path going roundÂ 
the circle so that it doesn't come downÂ Â

on top of him. So what if we spin an orangeÂ 
well as you know oranges don't just haveÂ Â

juice inside as one bucket of water sort of thingÂ 
they have lots of little sacks of juice so that'dÂ Â

be a bit more like spinning say a bucket full ofÂ

He's such a good sport and as you can see theÂ 
water balloons are not falling out and if we haveÂ Â

just lots of little sections. Now i think that ifÂ

ridiculously fast you could damage all thoseÂ 
little membranes inside and maybe turn it intoÂ Â

there's no reason for that to gel into jellyÂ

is called parasites in pork don't like pepsi. TheyÂ 
basically get pepsi and pour it onto their porkÂ Â

and then they say these are littleÂ 
worms and if we fast forward.Â Â

Oh gross! Let me try putting pepsi on porkÂ 
the things we do and let's see what happensÂ Â

pour on the pepsi and then let's zoom in andÂ 
see if anything comes out. Oh look at thatÂ Â

wow so there's another one ... why is thisÂ 
happening let me zoom out and show you why that'sÂ Â

happening. I have a needle going through the paperÂ 
plate and into the pork sitting just under theÂ Â

surface so i can press out the fat on top and itÂ 
can look a little bit like a worm but it's not aÂ Â

worm it's just white fat. Personally i think thatÂ 
this prank is one of the more dangerous ones toÂ Â

be shared around the internet and the reason forÂ 
that is because pork parasites are a real thing,Â Â

the most commonly known one would be trichonellaÂ 
which can cause trichonellosis. what happens ifÂ Â

you eat meat that is infected with the triconellaÂ 
larvae is when you eat it and the meat getsÂ Â

digested the larvae gets released from the meatÂ 
it sits in your intestine for a couple of days andÂ Â

grows to full size in that time you can get nauseaÂ 
and vomiting and diarrhea and feel quite unwellÂ Â

but then that larvae travels in your bloodstreamÂ 
and gets into your muscle tissues where it canÂ Â

cause an immune response and swelling particularlyÂ 
around the eye area and depending where they go toÂ Â

it can cause very serious illnesses and muscleÂ 
pain and can make you sick for months so they'reÂ Â

showing how to test if your pork has this parasiteÂ 
but it's the wrong test! This is not going toÂ Â

work you could have trichonella larvae in yourÂ 
meat pour pepsi on it and you will not see it,Â Â

if you want to know if it's in your meat what youÂ 
need to do which is what they do here in AustraliaÂ Â

and they do in the US before the meat gets toÂ 
the market so they know if you're buying porkÂ Â

at the shops it's very very unlikely in the US orÂ 
australia to have this in it they have to pureeÂ Â

the meat up then they digest it using stomach acidÂ 
which is a lot stronger than your pepsi or yourÂ Â

coke and then they keep it warm and agitate it forÂ 
about 20 minutes to digest that meat. They thenÂ Â

pour it into different beakers just to concentrateÂ 
it down and now that fluid there you can see youÂ Â

can't see any worms in it with the naked eyeÂ 
because the larvae are tiny they put it underÂ Â

a microscope and there you go now you can see theÂ 
little trickinella larvae that were there in thatÂ Â

meat but you would not be able to see it with yourÂ 
naked eye even if the pepsi could digest the meatÂ Â

you will not see it just looking at it, so byÂ 
saying to someone you can test your meat this wayÂ Â

that's not a good thing. There are countriesÂ 
where this is a big issue and also for peopleÂ Â

if you're in the US the number one cause ofÂ 
people getting it there is people hunting theirÂ Â

own meat particularly bears or wild boar and thenÂ 
eating it. So if you think you can test your meatÂ Â

this is not going to work for you. So what youÂ 
need to do is cook it really really well becauseÂ Â

heat is going to kill it there's no rare steaks!Â

Arrange some sugar into a number five shape turnÂ

cake put sugar into a pan and add enough water toÂ 
make it wet then turn on the heat and stir untilÂ Â

the sugar is dissolved wash down the sides of theÂ 
pan using a wet pastry brush this is important toÂ Â

get any sugar crystals off the sides and then letÂ

golden it goes from golden to burnt very quicklyÂ 
so pull it off the heat. now pour that onto aÂ Â

non-stick baking paper in the shape of a five youÂ 
should have enough there to make a few so you canÂ Â

choose your favorite one. once it's cool it justÂ
